name: rice production, non-basmati | rice, non-basmati | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20816/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of Rice Non-Basmati during June-October, 2016 at a farm located in village Village-Gadhera, District- Fatehgarh Sahib of Punjab. In this area, fields are irrigated using electric pump and diesel pump from groundwater for surface irrigation. The farm has a yield of 7750 kg fresh matter per ha for this crop cycle. Sowing date for the crop is 20- June, 2016 and harvesting date is 31-October, 2016. Mineral NP fertilizer input is 84.77-48.53 kg/ha. Herbicides used has active ingredient as Butachlor 1250g/ha (for which Alachlor has been used as proxy). Fungicides used has active ingredients as Propiconazole 156.25g/ha, Insecticides used has active ingredient Chlorpyriphos 125g/ha, Monocrotophos 450g/ha (for which Dichlorovos has been used as proxy), and Cartap Hydrochloride 8750g/ha (for which Carbosulfan has been used as proxy). Machinery is used for soil cultivation with fuel consumption of 43.68 kg/ha using plough, rotary cultivator for soil tillage and for other works. Machines is used for harvesting with fuel consumption of 78kg/ha using Threshing for combine harvesting and hay reaping. For other work process 7.1136 kg/ha is used for laser levelling. 

This activity starts about seven weeks after the harvest of the previous crop. The soil is prepared for cultivation in June and sowing of seeds started about three weeks after soil preparation. Thereafter the crop is mature for harvesting in about 4.5 months.


The activity ends with the harvesting of the matured non-basmati rice plant. Thereafter the field is prepared for cultivation of the next crop.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0112:Growing of rice

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Soil cultivating date for the main crop: 01-June, 2016; Harvesting date main crop: 31-October, 2016. The soil cultivation, sowing and harvesting dates are taken as the middle date of the week or fortnight told to the data collector by the farmer. Total time from date of sowing to date of harvesting comes to 130 days.  The data is collected for one crop cycle. The cycle of one year is considered for entry in ecoeditor.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: village Village-Gadhera, District- Fatehgarh Sahib of Punjab
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of Non-Basmati Rice follows conventional production standards
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process. Number of wet days have been taken for neighboring district (Ludhiana) and rainfall data is Normal rainfall for Punjab State in India where the farm is located. The data has been approximated using Wheat as proxy since the tool at this stage could not support non existing crops in ecoeditor.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The farmers were identified and contacted by agriculture science faculty familiar with the local farmers in the region. Data was collected directly from the farmers through semi-structured interview using a questionnaire based on the input requirements of the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production. The farmers do not maintain any written records and have provided the data from recent memory. In this region, typically farmers are unable to provide exact name of active ingredient in the pesticide they use and the same was noted from details given on the pesticide packet. Individual farmer is not able to calculate fuel consumption for his own farm alone and this information has been collected from farming community of the area.

flow.name: Energy, gross calorific value, in biomass

exchanges.description:
The total water (blue + green) used for the production of 1 kg of paddy rice in India is 1.903 m3, where blue water is 0.826 m3 and green water is 1.077 m3. For irrigation only blue water is considered. Therefore, 0.826 m3/kg paddy rice.
Source: Chapagain, A.K., Hoekstra, A.Y. (2010). The green, blue and grey water footprint of rice from both a production and consumption perspective. Value of Water Research Report Series No. 40. Accessed on 20231020: https://www.waterfootprint.org/resources/Report40-WaterFootprintRice.pdf

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'rice' is calculated to be circa 1.72E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 3.44E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Calculated Value. This value has been calculated by using the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production

Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of rice is calculated to be circa 1.38E-03 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[thio]carbamate-compound', 'acetamide-anillide-compound, unspecified', 'cyclic N-compound', 'organophosphorus-compound, unspecified'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.77E-03 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.
